intro: Metastelma sessilifolium, commonly known as the sessile-leaved metastelma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically has opposite, sessile leaves that are lanceolate in shape. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation in suitable climates.
